recipes.name: Classic Pork Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 pound Chinese barbecued pork, cut into matchsticks
1 cup dried wood ear mushrooms, rehydrated and shredded
directions: Step 1: Heat 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Pour in the beaten eggs and cook without stirring until set. Flip and cook for 20 seconds. Set aside to cool, then slice into thin strips.

Step 2: Heat the remaining 3 teaspoons of vegetable oil in the wok over high heat. Add cabbage and carrot; cook for 2 minutes until slightly wilted. Add pork, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, green onions, soy sauce, salt, and sugar. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 6 minutes. Stir in the sliced egg.
Step 3: Spread the filling on a pan and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to cool completely.

Step 4: Place an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place about 3 tablespoons of filling on the bottom third of the wrapper. Brush egg white on the top two edges.

Step 5: Fold the bottom corner over the filling and roll tightly to the halfway point. Fold the left and right sides over, then continue rolling to seal with the egg white. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling, covering finished egg rolls with plastic wrap.
Step 6: Heat about 6 inches of oil in a wok or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C).
Step 7: Fry egg rolls in batches until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of three crispy golden-brown pork egg rolls, one partially bitten into to reveal the savory filling.  Use a dark, textured backdrop and rustic wooden serving board. Garnish with fresh cilantro and a small dish of sweet chili sauce.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the filling of the bitten egg roll, with soft, diffused lighting to highlight the textures and steam. Aim for a warm, inviting mood, emphasizing the freshness and deliciousness of the ingredients.

video_script.title: Classic Pork Egg Rolls
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy and delicious classic pork egg rolls with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of several golden-brown, crispy pork egg rolls, plated on a decorative serving dish with a side of sweet and sour sauce. Steam gently rises from the egg rolls, showcasing their freshness.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our kitchen! Today, we're making classic pork egg rolls - crispy on the outside, packed with savory filling on the inside. Get ready for a flavor explosion!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board. Group related ingredients together, for example, vegetables together, dry goods together, etc.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients. We have cabbage, carrots, Chinese barbecued pork, bamboo shoots, wood ear mushrooms, green onions. Also, eggs, soy sauce, salt, sugar, egg roll wrappers, and vegetable oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a wok with beaten eggs being cooked, then flipped and cooked briefly.
scenes.voice_over: First, we'll cook the eggs. Heat a teaspoon of oil in a wok over medium heat, pour in the beaten eggs. Cook until set, flip, and cook for another 20 seconds. Once cooled, slice into thin strips.

scenes.image_prompt: The wok now with cabbage and carrots being stir-fried. Focus on the vibrant colors of the vegetables as they cook.
scenes.voice_over: Next, stir-fry the shredded cabbage and carrots in the remaining oil for 2 minutes until slightly wilted.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the wok with all the filling ingredients, including pork, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and green onions, being stir-fried together.
scenes.voice_over: Add the barbecued pork, bamboo shoots, wood ear mushrooms, green onions, soy sauce, salt, and sugar. Cook for about 6 minutes, then stir in the sliced egg.

scenes.image_prompt: The filling spread out on a pan, being placed in the refrigerator.
scenes.voice_over: Spread the filling on a pan and refrigerate for at least an hour to cool completely. This will help prevent soggy egg rolls.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands demonstrating how to fill and roll an egg roll, focusing on the neat folds and the application of egg white as glue.
scenes.voice_over: Place a wrapper with a corner facing you, add 3 tablespoons of filling, brush egg white on the edges, fold, and roll tightly. Repeat until all filling is used.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls frying in hot oil, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry egg rolls in batches for 5-7 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished egg rolls, golden brown and crispy, plated on a serving dish with a dipping sauce and garnished with chopped green onions. A close up showcases the crispy texture.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Crispy, flavorful pork egg rolls. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce and enjoy! These are perfect as a snack, appetizer, or part of a larger meal.

cooking_tips: For crispier egg rolls, double fry them. Fry once as directed, then let cool slightly and fry again for 1-2 minutes until extra crispy.
If you don't have wood ear mushrooms, you can substitute with shiitake or cloud ear mushrooms.
You can adjust the amount of filling based on your preference. Use less for smaller, tighter rolls, or more for larger, fuller rolls.

recipes.name: Chinese Chicken and Brussels Sprout Egg Rolls with Sweet Chili Pomegranate Sauce
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a resealable bag or bowl, combine 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1/2 tablespoon fish sauce (if using), 1 teaspoon hoisin sauce, and the Chinese five-spice powder. Add 1 clove minced garlic, grated ginger, 2 sliced green onions, and 1 tablespoon sesame oil. Add the cubed chicken, seal the bag, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 3 hours.

Step 2: Cook the Chicken: Heat 2 tablespoons sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.

Step 3: Cook the Vegetables: Add the remaining 1 tablespoon sesame oil to the pan. Add the shredded Brussels sprouts, carrots, and mushrooms. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1/2 tablespoon fish sauce (if using), and 1 teaspoon hoisin sauce. Cook for 8-10 minutes, or until tender-crisp. Add the remaining garlic and green onions; cook for 1 minute more. Return the cooked chicken to the pan and combine.

Step 4: Assemble the Egg Rolls: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place 1-2 tablespoons of filling in the center. Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Roll tightly away from you, sealing the top corner with a bit of beaten egg.

Step 5: Fry or Bake the Egg Rolls: To fry: Heat 3 inches of oil to 375°F (190°C). Fry egg rolls in batches until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. To bake: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Spray egg rolls with cooking spray and bake for 10-15 minutes, until golden.

Step 6: Make the Sweet Chili Pomegranate Sauce: In a saucepan, combine sweet Thai chili sauce, soy sauce, pomegranate juice, brown sugar, and rice vinegar. Bring to a boil and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly, and stir in pomegranate arils.
Step 7: Serve: Serve warm egg rolls with the Sweet Chili Pomegranate Sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of three crispy golden-brown Chinese Chicken and Brussels Sprout Egg Rolls, one cut open to reveal the savory filling. Arrange them on a dark slate surface with a small bowl of vibrant Sweet Chili Pomegranate Sauce for dipping. Garnish with fresh pomegranate seeds and chopped cilantro. Use soft, diffused lighting to highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood. Shallow depth of field with focus on the cut egg roll, showcasing the steam rising from the filling. Use a dark, textured background to provide contrast and depth.

Add the cubed chicken, seal the bag, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 3 hours for maximum flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken browning in a wok or large skillet over high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Brussels sprouts, carrots, and mushrooms cooking in the same wok, with the cooked chicken set aside in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Add the shredded Brussels sprouts, carrots, and sliced mushrooms to the pan. Stir in soy sauce, fish sauce, and hoisin sauce.  Cook for 8-10 minutes, or until tender-crisp.  Add remaining garlic and green onions, cook for 1 minute more. Return the cooked chicken to the pan and combine.

scenes.image_prompt: Step-by-step demonstration of filling and rolling an egg roll, showing how to fold the corners and seal with beaten egg.
scenes.voice_over: Place an egg roll wrapper with one corner facing you. Add a spoonful of filling to the center. Fold the bottom corner up, then the side corners in. Roll tightly away from you, sealing the top corner with a bit of beaten egg.

scenes.image_prompt: Golden-brown egg rolls frying in hot oil, or alternatively, egg rolls baking on a baking sheet in the oven.
scenes.voice_over: To fry: Heat oil to 375°F (190°C). Fry egg rolls until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes. To bake: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Spray egg rolls with cooking spray and bake for 10-15 minutes, until golden.

scenes.image_prompt: Sweet chili pomegranate sauce simmering in a saucepan, with pomegranate arils being stirred in.
scenes.voice_over: Combine sweet Thai chili sauce, soy sauce, pomegranate juice, brown sugar, and rice vinegar in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 5-8 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat, cool slightly, and stir in pomegranate arils.

scenes.image_prompt: Plated egg rolls with a small bowl of the Sweet Chili Pomegranate Sauce. Garnish with extra pomegranate arils and chopped green onions.  Suggest serving with chopsticks or a fork.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your crispy chicken and Brussels sprout egg rolls with the delicious sweet chili pomegranate sauce.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a vegetarian option, substitute the chicken with 8 ounces of sliced mushrooms.
If you don't have a wok, a large skillet will work just as well.
Don't overcrowd the pan when frying the egg rolls, or they won't cook evenly.
Serve immediately for the best crispy texture.

recipes.name: Crispy Baked Egg Rolls
ingredients: 2 (8-ounce) cans bamboo shoots, drained and chopped
1/2 cup dried mushrooms, cut into strips
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line baking sheets with nonstick foil.

Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add bamboo shoots and bean sprouts; cook until heated through. Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce and sauté until vegetables are coated. Remove from pan and set aside.
Step 3: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in the same pan. Sauté dried mushrooms and onion until softened. Remove from pan and set aside.
Step 4: In a medium bowl, combine ground chicken, remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce, dry sherry, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and salt.
Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in the same pan. Cook ground chicken mixture until cooked through and no longer pink.
Step 6: Return cooked vegetables and ginger to the pan with the chicken. Stir to combine. Remove from heat and let cool.
Step 7: In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch and cold water.
Step 8: Place one egg roll wrapper on a flat surface. Moisten edges with cornstarch mixture.
Step 9: Spoon filling diagonally onto the center of the wrapper.
Step 10: Fold bottom corner over filling, then fold in sides snugly. Moisten top corner and roll up to seal.
Step 11: Place filled egg roll seam-down on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
Step 12: Brush egg rolls lightly with remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil.

Step 13: Place a pan half-filled with water on the bottom rack of the preheated oven. Place the baking sheet with egg rolls on a rack above the water pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Step 14: Serve hot with desired dipping sauces.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy baked egg rolls on a dark slate surface, angled slightly to showcase their golden-brown texture.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the crispy edges of a bisected egg roll revealing the savory filling.  Soft, directional lighting should highlight the steam rising from the filling. Garnish with fresh bean sprouts and chopped green onions. Include a small dipping bowl of soy sauce in the background.  The mood should be warm and inviting.

recipes.name: Crispy Avocado Egg Rolls with Tangy Tamarind Dipping Sauce
ingredients: 1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes, oil-packed, drained and chopped
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Filling: In a large bowl, combine the chopped sun-dried tomatoes, avocados, minced cilantro, diced red onion, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Gently mix until well combined.
Step 2: Assemble the Egg Rolls: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place 1-2 tablespoons of the avocado mixture in the center of the wrapper.

Step 3: Roll the Egg Rolls: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Tightly roll the wrapper away from you to form a cigar shape. Moisten the top corner with water to seal.
Step 4: Fry the Egg Rolls: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 350°F (175°C). Carefully place 3-4 egg rolls in the hot oil and fry for 3-4 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 5: Drain and Rest: Remove the fried egg rolls from the oil and place them on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

Step 6: Prepare the Dipping Sauce: While the egg rolls are frying, prepare the dipping sauce. In a blender or food processor, combine the white vinegar, balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon lime juice, sugar, tamarind concentrate, turmeric, cumin, sliced green onions, minced garlic, chopped cashews, cilantro leaves, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Blend until smooth.
Step 7: Serve: Slice the egg rolls in half diagonally and serve immediately with the tangy tamarind dipping sauce.

A small bowl of vibrant tamarind dipping sauce, garnished with a lime wedge, sits alongside.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on a halved egg roll revealing the creamy avocado filling.  Soft, directional light should highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase both the egg rolls and the dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Crispy Pork Egg Rolls
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, ginger, and garlic powder. Mix until thoroughly combined.
Step 2: Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the seasoned pork and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and crumbly, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 3: In a large bowl, combine the cooked pork, shredded cabbage, and shredded carrots. Mix well.
Step 4: In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and water until a smooth paste forms.
Step 5: Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet or wok to 375°F (190°C).

Step 6: While the oil is heating, assemble the egg rolls. Lay one egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place about ¼ to ⅓ cup of the pork filling in the center of the wrapper.

Step 7: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper up and over the filling. Fold the left and right corners in towards the center, then tightly roll the egg roll away from you towards the top corner. Brush a bit of the flour paste onto the top corner to seal.
Step 8: Carefully place the egg rolls in the hot oil, ensuring not to overcrowd the skillet. Fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, about 5-8 minutes.
Step 9: Remove the egg rolls from the oil and place them on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Step 10: Serve the egg rolls hot, sprinkled with sesame seeds (if desired).

recipes.name: Shanghai Spring Rolls
ingredients: 1/2 lb small shrimp, peeled and deveined
8-10 dried Chinese mushrooms, rehydrated and shredded
2 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more for deep frying
2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water, to make a slurry
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the ground pork and stir-fry until browned. Add the shredded chicken and stir-fry until cooked through. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink and opaque. Remove the meat and shrimp from the wok and set aside.
Step 2: Add a little more oil to the wok if needed. Stir-fry the scallions for a few seconds, then add the mushrooms and cabbage. Stir-fry until the cabbage wilts, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 3: In a small bowl, combine the chicken stock, salt, dry sherry, and sugar. Pour the sauce over the vegetables in the wok and bring to a boil.
Step 4: Add the cornstarch slurry to the wok and stir until the sauce thickens.
Step 5: Return the cooked pork, chicken, and shrimp to the wok. Stir in the sesame oil and remove from heat. Set aside to cool completely.

Step 6: Lay out an egg roll wrapper with one corner pointing towards you. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Roll up tightly and seal the top corner with a little beaten egg.

Step 7: Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 325°F (160°C). Deep fry the spring rolls in batches until lightly golden, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels. (At this point, the spring rolls can be frozen for later use.)
Step 8: To serve, heat the oil to 375°F (190°C). Deep fry the spring rolls until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

Soft, directional light from the left should highlight the textures and create gentle shadows. The background should be dark and moody with subtle texture, allowing the spring rolls to be the hero. video_script.title: Crispy Shanghai Spring Rolls
video_script.description: Learn to make delicious and crispy Shanghai spring rolls with this easy-to-follow recipe!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of golden-brown, crispy Shanghai spring rolls, served with a dipping sauce. Steam rises enticingly from the rolls, showcasing their crispy texture. Focus on the appealing details of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our kitchen! Today, we're making crispy Shanghai spring rolls, filled with savory pork, chicken, shrimp, and fresh vegetables. These rolls are perfect as a snack or appetizer.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all the ingredients neatly arranged on a table: ground pork, shredded chicken, shrimp, shredded cabbage, dried Chinese mushrooms (rehydrated), scallions, chicken stock, dry sherry, sugar, cornstarch slurry, sesame oil, eggs, and egg roll wrappers.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a wok over high heat, ground pork browning, shredded chicken cooking through, and shrimp turning pink.
scenes.voice_over: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Stir-fry the pork until browned, then add the chicken and cook until done. Finally, add the shrimp and cook until pink. Remove from wok.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of scallions, mushrooms, and cabbage stir-frying in the wok. Show the cabbage wilting slightly.
scenes.voice_over: Add a bit more oil if needed, then stir-fry the scallions, followed by the mushrooms and cabbage. Cook until the cabbage wilts, about 2-3 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: The wok with the wilted vegetables, then the sauce being poured over the vegetables. The sauce bubbling and thickening after adding the cornstarch slurry.
scenes.voice_over: Combine chicken stock, salt, sherry, and sugar. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and bring to a boil. Add the cornstarch slurry and stir until thickened.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked meat and shrimp being added back to the wok with the vegetables and sauce. Sesame oil being drizzled into the mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Return the cooked meat and shrimp to the wok. Stir in the sesame oil and remove from heat. Let the filling cool completely.

scenes.image_prompt: Step-by-step demonstration of filling and rolling the egg roll wrappers, sealing the edges with beaten egg.
scenes.voice_over: Place a spoonful of filling on a wrapper. Fold the bottom corner over, then the side corners. Roll up tightly and seal with egg.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls deep-frying in hot oil until golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat oil to 325°F (160°C). Fry the spring rolls until lightly golden, about 5-7 minutes. These can be frozen at this stage.

scenes.image_prompt: Golden brown, crispy spring rolls being removed from the fryer and placed on a wire rack to drain.
scenes.voice_over: To serve, heat the oil to 375°F (190°C). Fry until golden and crispy, 2-3 minutes. Drain and serve hot.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished Shanghai spring rolls, plated attractively with a dipping sauce and garnished with fresh herbs, maybe on a bed of lettuce.
scenes.voice_over: Your crispy Shanghai spring rolls are ready! Enjoy them with your favorite dipping sauce.

cooking_tips: For extra crispy spring rolls, double fry them as directed. You can also bake the spring rolls at 400°F (200°C) for about 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, for a healthier option.
Adjust the amount of salt and sugar in the filling according to your preference.

recipes.name: Pizza Egg Rolls
ingredients: 8 ounces mozzarella cheese, cut into 6-inch sticks
directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: Cut the mozzarella cheese into 6-inch sticks.
Step 3: Lay one egg roll wrapper on a flat surface like a diamond. Place 1 teaspoon of marinara sauce, 1 mozzarella stick, and 2 tablespoons of mini pepperoni on the bottom third of the wrapper.
Step 4: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, towards the center. Fold in the left and right sides like an envelope.
Step 5: Roll the egg roll up tightly, leaving only the top corner exposed. Brush the top corner with water and fold it down to seal. Use more water if needed to fully seal the edges.
Step 6: Repeat steps 3-5 for the remaining egg rolls.
Step 7: Brush the tops of the egg rolls with olive oil and sprinkle with Italian seasoning and garlic salt.
Step 8: Lightly brush the air fryer basket with olive oil. Place the egg rolls seam-down in the basket, ensuring they don't touch.
Step 9: Reduce the air fryer temperature to 360°F (180°C) and cook for 8 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Step 10: Serve hot with the remaining marinara sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy, golden-brown pizza egg rolls on a dark, rustic wooden board, styled with a small cast iron skillet of marinara for dipping. Sprinkle fresh parsley around the board. Shoot from a slightly overhead, 45-degree angle, with shallow depth of field focusing on the cut edge of a gooey, cheese-pulling egg roll. Backlighting should create a warm, inviting mood, highlighting the texture of the wrappers and the vibrant colors of the marinara and pepperoni peeking through. Use minimal props and a dark background to emphasize the dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Demonstration of folding the egg roll wrapper, first the bottom corner, then the sides tucked in like an envelope, and finally rolling it up tightly, sealing the top corner with water.

scenes.image_prompt: Several finished egg rolls, brushed with olive oil and sprinkled with Italian seasoning and garlic salt.
scenes.voice_over: Repeat with remaining wrappers. Brush the egg rolls with olive oil and sprinkle with Italian seasoning and garlic salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls placed seam-down in an air fryer basket, not touching each other. The basket is lightly brushed with olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Lightly grease your air fryer basket.  Place the egg rolls seam-down, making sure they aren't overcrowded.  We'll air fry at 360°F (180°C) for 8 minutes, flipping halfway.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of perfectly cooked, golden-brown pizza egg rolls being flipped over in the air fryer basket at the 4-minute mark.
scenes.voice_over: Halfway through, flip those egg rolls for even cooking and maximum crispiness.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished golden-brown pizza egg rolls being removed from the air fryer basket and plated.
scenes.voice_over: After 8 minutes, your pizza egg rolls are ready! Carefully remove them from the air fryer.

recipes.name: Crispy Air Fryer Veggie Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles, drained
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the thawed corn, drained black beans, drained spinach, shredded jalapeno Jack cheese, shredded Cheddar cheese, drained green chiles, sliced green onions, salt, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
Step 2: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface at a diamond angle. Lightly moisten all four edges of the wrapper with water. Place about 1/4 cup of the filling in the center of the wrapper.

Step 3: Fold one corner of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and tightly roll up to form an egg roll. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling. Lightly mist each egg roll with cooking spray.
Step 4: Preheat an air fryer to 390°F (199°C). Arrange the egg rolls in the air fryer basket, ensuring they are not touching (cook in batches if necessary).
Step 5: Air fry for 8 minutes, then flip the egg rolls and cook for another 4 minutes, or until the wrappers are golden brown and crispy.

Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the golden, textured egg roll filling bursting from a freshly cut end. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase both the full and cut egg rolls.  Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Crispy Southwest Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the thawed corn, drained and rinsed black beans, drained spinach, shredded jalapeño Jack cheese, shredded Cheddar cheese, drained green chiles, sliced green onions, salt, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
Step 2: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface at a diamond shape (one corner pointing towards you). Lightly moisten all four edges of the wrapper with water.
Step 3: Place about 1/4 cup of the filling in the center of the wrapper.
Step 4: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper up and over the filling, then tuck in the two side corners. Roll tightly to enclose the filling completely.
Step 5: Repeat steps 2-4 with the remaining wrappers and filling. Lightly mist each egg roll with cooking spray.
Step 6: Preheat an air fryer to 390°F (199°C).
Step 7: Arrange the egg rolls in the air fryer basket in a single layer, ensuring they are not touching. Cook in batches if necessary.
Step 8: Air fry for 8 minutes, then flip the egg rolls and continue cooking until the skins are golden brown and crispy, about 4 minutes more.

recipes.name: Chicken and Shrimp Egg Rolls
ingredients: 8 cups low-sodium chicken stock (homemade or store-bought)
1 bunch scallions, trimmed and roughly chopped
2 pieces fresh ginger, peeled and sliced
0.5 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 Granny Smith apple, peeled, cored, and diced
directions: Step 1: In a large pot, combine chicken stock, scallions, ginger, garlic, and 3 tablespoons of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Turn off heat and add chicken breasts. Let stand for 8 minutes, then remove chicken and let cool. Cut chicken into 1/2-inch cubes and set aside.
Step 2: Return the stock mixture to a boil. Turn off heat and add shrimp. Let stand for 5 minutes, then remove shrimp and let cool. Cut shrimp in half lengthwise and set aside.
Step 3: In a large bowl, toss the sliced cabbage with 4 tablespoons of coarse salt. Place in a colander and let drain for 20 minutes.
Step 4: In another large bowl, combine cilantro stems, chile, apple, diced chicken, and shrimp. Add the drained cabbage and toss until well combined.

Step 5: Place one egg roll wrapper on a lightly floured work surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out to 1/8 inch thick. Rotate wrapper so that one of the points is closest to the edge of your work surface.

Step 6: Place about 2 tablespoons of filling in the center of the wrapper, ensuring a couple of shrimp pieces are in each egg roll. Fold the point closest to the edge of the work surface up and over the filling, then fold the points on the right and left sides over the filling. Roll the wrapper away from you to form a cylinder.

Step 7: Fill a large heavy-bottomed saucepan with canola oil to a depth of 3 inches. Place over medium-high heat. When the oil reaches 375°F (190°C) on a deep-fry thermometer, fry egg rolls in batches until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels.
Step 8: Serve immediately with Egg Roll Dipping Sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of three crispy golden-brown Chicken and Shrimp Egg Rolls, diagonally arranged on a dark slate board.  Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs and a small bowl of sweet chili dipping sauce. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the nearest egg roll's flaky texture.  Soft, diffused lighting should highlight the golden hues and create a warm, inviting mood. The background should be a subtly textured dark grey to provide contrast and depth.

recipes.name: Crispy Chicken Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 cup mung bean sprouts, rinsed and drained
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Chicken: Pat the chicken breast dry and cut into thin strips. In a bowl, combine 1 tablespoon soy sauce, salt, pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch. Add the chicken strips and marinate for 15 minutes.

Step 2: Prepare the Sauces: In a small bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon water and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons water, oyster sauce, 2 teaspoons soy sauce, and sugar. Set aside.

Step 3: Stir-fry the Chicken: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until it changes color and is 80% cooked. Remove the chicken from the wok and set aside.

Step 4: Stir-fry the Vegetables: Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the wok. Add the minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Add the celery and onion, and stir-fry until the onion begins to brown. Add the bell pepper, mushrooms, and bean sprouts. Season with a pinch of salt and/or sugar, if desired. Stir in the green onions.

Step 5: Combine and Thicken: Return the cooked chicken to the wok. Push the chicken and vegetables to the sides of the wok, creating a space in the center. Pour the oyster sauce mixture into the center. Give the cornstarch and water mixture a quick stir and add it to the oyster sauce mixture, stirring quickly to thicken the sauce. Mix everything together until well combined. Remove from heat and let cool.

Step 6: Assemble the Egg Rolls: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place 3 to 4 tablespoons of the filling in the center of the wrapper, leaving a border around the edges.  Mix 2 tablespoons cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water to create a sealing paste. Brush the edges of the wrapper with the cornstarch paste.
Step 7: Fold and Seal Egg Rolls: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, tucking it in tightly. Fold in the sides and roll up the egg roll tightly. Press down on the top edge to seal.

Step 8: Deep-Fry: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F (190°C). Carefully add the egg rolls to the hot oil, a few at a time, and deep-fry until golden brown, about 3-5 minutes. Remove the egg rolls and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with sweet and sour sauce and/or hot mustard.
Step 9: Serve: Serve immediately with your choice of dipping sauces.

Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the foreground egg roll's flaky texture and savory filling. Soft, diffused natural light from the side highlights the golden hues. Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs and a small bowl of sweet chili dipping sauce in the background. The mood should be warm, inviting, and appetizing with a slightly dark, moody backdrop. recipes.name: Air-Fried Apple Pie Egg Rolls
ingredients: 2 medium Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch chunks
directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: In a medium saucepan, combine the prepared apples, lemon juice, and water. Stir to coat.
Step 3: Sprinkle brown sugar and ¼ teaspoon of cinnamon over the apples and stir again.
Step 4: Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until apples reach desired softness, about 20-25 minutes.
Step 5: Sprinkle apples with ½ tablespoon of white sugar and stir. Cook for 5 more minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Step 6: Prepare a small bowl of water for sealing the egg rolls. Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with a corner pointing towards you.
Step 7: Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of the cooled apple mixture in the center of the wrapper.
Step 8: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper up and over the filling, tucking the end around it. Gently roll up once.
Step 9: Moisten the side edges of the wrapper with water and fold them over the filling, creating a sealed edge.
Step 10: Continue rolling the egg roll tightly and brush the final corner with water to seal.
Step 11: In a small bowl, combine ¼ cup white sugar and the remaining 1 teaspoon cinnamon.
Step 12: Gently roll the filled egg roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Step 13: Repeat steps 6-12 with the remaining filling and wrappers.
Step 14: Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper.
Step 15: Carefully place the prepared egg rolls in the air fryer basket, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
Step 16: Air-fry for 7 minutes, then flip the egg rolls.
Step 17: Continue air-frying until golden brown, about 7 more minutes.

recipes.name: Oopsie Eggs Benedict
directions: Step 1: Prepare Hollandaise Sauce: Separate 2 eggs and whisk the yolks in a glass bowl until doubled in volume. Add lemon juice and whisk again.
Step 2: Set up Double Boiler: Bring about an inch of water to a simmer in a saucepan. Place the glass bowl with egg yolks over the simmering water, ensuring the bottom doesn't touch the water.
Step 3: Melt Butter: In a separate pan, melt the butter.
Step 4: Cook Hollandaise: Whisk the egg yolks rapidly over the double boiler until they thicken. Slowly pour in the melted butter while whisking constantly. Be careful not to overcook the yolks.

Step 5: Finish Hollandaise: Once the hollandaise sauce thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon, remove from heat and season with salt and paprika. If the sauce becomes too thick, whisk in a teaspoon of water.
Step 6: Poach Eggs: Bring a pot with about 3 inches of water to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, add salt and white vinegar.
Step 7: Create Whirlpool: Stir the simmering water with a wooden spoon to create a gentle whirlpool.
Step 8: Add Eggs to Water: Crack each egg into a separate teacup. Gently lower each teacup into the water and slide the egg into the whirlpool. Cook for 2-4 minutes for runny yolks.
Step 9: Remove Eggs: Gently lift the poached eggs with a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate.
Step 10: Cook Canadian Bacon (Optional): Fry the Canadian bacon until crispy.
Step 11: Assemble Eggs Benedict: Place each slice of Canadian bacon on an Oopsie roll. Top with a poached egg and a spoonful of hollandaise sauce. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and chopped chives.
Step 12: Serve Immediately: Enjoy your Oopsie Eggs Benedict right away.

video_script.title: Oopsie Eggs Benedict: A Keto-Friendly Delight

scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a keto-friendly twist on a classic brunch favorite: Oopsie Eggs Benedict. It's packed with flavor and surprisingly easy to make.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Oopsie rolls, eggs, Canadian bacon, chives, and basic seasonings.  For the hollandaise, we'll need butter, egg yolks, lemon juice, salt, and paprika.  And don't forget the white vinegar for poaching the eggs.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisk egg yolks in a glass bowl. Show melted butter, and lemon juice nearby.
scenes.voice_over: First, let's prepare the star of the show: the hollandaise sauce. Whisk two egg yolks with lemon juice in a glass bowl until light and frothy. Melt two tablespoons of butter separately.

scenes.image_prompt: Glass bowl placed over simmering water.  Whisk the yolks constantly as melted butter is poured in slowly.
scenes.voice_over: Place the bowl over simmering water, creating a double boiler. Ensure the bowl doesn't touch the water. Whisk constantly as you slowly drizzle in the melted butter until the sauce thickens enough to coat a spoon. Season with salt and paprika.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of water simmering in a pot.  A cracked egg is shown beside it.  Vinegar and a wooden spoon are in view.
scenes.voice_over: For perfectly poached eggs, gently simmer water with salt and white vinegar. Create a whirlpool to help the egg whites come together around the yolk. Gently slide the egg into the swirling water, cook for 2-4 minutes, then lift with a slotted spoon.

scenes.image_prompt: Canadian bacon being cooked until crispy.
scenes.voice_over: (Optional) While the eggs poach, fry the Canadian bacon until it reaches your desired crispiness.

scenes.voice_over: Now, to build our Eggs Benedict: Place the Canadian bacon on the Oopsie roll, top with a perfectly poached egg, and generously spoon over the luscious hollandaise. Garnish with fresh chives and a pinch of paprika.

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of the finished dish ready to be served.  Suggest serving with a side salad or sliced avocado.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! A low-carb, high-protein breakfast that will surely impress. Enjoy your Oopsie Eggs Benedict immediately, perhaps with a side salad or avocado slices. Thanks for watching!

cooking_tips: Use fresh, high-quality eggs for the best poaching results.
Don't overcook the hollandaise sauce, or it may curdle. Keep it warm while poaching the eggs.

recipes.name: Korean Rolled Omelet (Gyeran Mari)
directions: Step 1: In a medium-sized bowl, crack the eggs and whisk lightly. For a smoother texture, strain the eggs through a fine-mesh sieve. Add the rice wine and salt, whisking until well combined. Stir in the chopped green onion.
Step 2: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Add a thin layer of cooking oil, spreading it evenly across the pan. Reduce the heat to low.
Step 3: Pour a thin layer of the egg mixture into the hot pan, tilting to spread evenly. Cook until the edges are set and the top is 80-85% cooked.
Step 4: Sprinkle a layer of mozzarella cheese down the center of the omelet. Using a spatula and/or chopsticks, gently roll the omelet from one end to the other.
Step 5: Push the rolled omelet to one side of the pan. Add another thin layer of cooking oil to the empty space in the pan.
Step 6: Pour another thin layer of egg mixture onto the empty space. Once the top is 80-85% cooked, sprinkle with cheese and roll the omelet over the previous layer.
Step 7: Repeat steps 5 and 6 until all of the egg mixture has been used.
Step 8: Remove the rolled omelet from the pan and let it cool on a cutting board for 5-10 minutes before slicing into bite-sized pieces. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Crispy Chicken Spring Rolls
ingredients: 400g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, boiled and shredded
1 bunch spring onions, greens and whites separated and finely chopped
1 cup finely chopped green bell pepper (capsicum)
directions: Step 1: Heat the sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the garlic and fry for a few seconds until fragrant.
Step 3: Add the white parts of the spring onions and green chilies. Sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 4: Add the cabbage and carrot. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened and any excess water evaporates.
Step 5: Add the green bell pepper, celery (if using), shredded chicken, soy sauce, and red chili sauce. Mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Step 6: Add the green parts of the spring onions, salt, and pepper. Sauté for another minute.
Step 7: Remove from heat and let the filling cool completely.
Step 8: To assemble the spring rolls, take one wrapper and place 1-2 tablespoons of the filling at one corner. Apply cornstarch slurry to the edges of the wrapper.
Step 9: Roll the wrapper tightly once to secure the filling, then fold the sides inward. Continue rolling until you reach the opposite corner, ensuring the wrapper is sealed completely.
Step 10: Repeat steps 8-9 for the remaining wrappers and filling.
Step 11: Place the assembled spring rolls in the refrigerator for 45 minutes to firm up.
Step 12: Heat oil in a deep wok or large pot over medium-high heat.
Step 13: Deep fry the spring rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy.
Step 14: Remove the spring rolls from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Step 15: Cut the spring rolls in half (optional) and serve hot with your favorite chili sauce or dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Air Fryer Thai Peanut Chicken Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 medium carrot, very thinly sliced or ribboned
Non-stick cooking spray or sesame oil
directions: Step 1: Preheat air fryer to 390°F (or oven to 425°F).
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the shredded rotisserie chicken and Thai peanut sauce.

Step 3: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a clean, dry surface. Arrange one-quarter of the carrot, bell pepper, and green onions over the bottom third of the wrapper. Spoon 1/4 cup of the chicken mixture over the vegetables.
Step 4: Lightly moisten the edges of the wrapper with water. Fold the sides of the wrapper toward the center, then tightly roll from the bottom up.
Step 5: Repeat Step 3 and Step 4 with the remaining egg roll wrappers. Keep unused wrappers covered with a damp paper towel to prevent drying.
Step 6: Lightly spray the assembled egg rolls with non-stick cooking spray or sesame oil.

Step 7: Place the egg rolls in the preheated air fryer and cook for 6-8 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Alternatively, bake in a preheated oven at 425°F for 15-20 minutes, placing the egg rolls seam-down on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray.
Step 8: Slice each egg roll in half and serve with additional Thai peanut sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Crispy Ground Beef and Cabbage Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 (14-ounce) package angel hair shredded cabbage (or regular shredded cabbage)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard, for serving
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef. Season generously with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the cooked ground beef, shredded cabbage, and shredded carrots. Mix well and let sit for 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Step 3: Taste the mixture and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more salt, pepper, or garlic powder if desired.
Step 4: Heat canola oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C). Follow the manufacturer's instructions for safe operation.
Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk the egg to create an egg wash.
Step 6: Lay out an egg roll wrapper with one corner pointing towards you. Place 1-2 tablespoons of the beef and vegetable mixture in the center of the wrapper.
Step 7: Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Tightly roll the wrapper away from you, sealing the top corner with the egg wash.
Step 8: Carefully place 2-3 egg rolls into the hot oil and fry for 3-5 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 9: Remove the egg rolls with a slotted spoon and place them on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Step 10: Serve hot with Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard for dipping.

video_script.title: Crispy Ground Beef and Cabbage Egg Rolls
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy and delicious ground beef and cabbage egg rolls with this easy-to-follow recipe!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of several golden brown, crispy egg rolls stacked on a plate, with a small bowl of Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard in the foreground. Focus on the crispy texture of the egg rolls and the vibrant color of the mustard.
scenes.text: Crispy Ground Beef & Cabbage Egg Rolls
scenes.voice_over: Craving a savory, crispy, and satisfying snack or meal? Look no further! Today, we're making delicious ground beef and cabbage egg rolls, perfect for any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a clean surface. Group related items like the ground beef package next to the spices, the cabbage next to carrots, and egg roll wrappers with egg.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: one pound of ground beef, a 14-ounce package of shredded cabbage, a 10-ounce package of shredded carrots, 1-2 packages of egg roll wrappers depending on how many you want to make, one large egg, canola oil for frying, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard for serving.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of ground beef browning in a skillet with steam rising. Focus on the texture of the beef as it cooks.
scenes.voice_over: First, brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season generously with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Drain off any excess grease.

scenes.image_prompt: A large bowl with the cooked ground beef, shredded cabbage, and carrots being mixed together.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the cooked ground beef, shredded cabbage, and shredded carrots. Mix well. Let it sit for about 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.  Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of an egg being whisked in a small bowl until light and frothy.
scenes.voice_over: Whisk an egg in a small bowl to create an egg wash. This will help seal our egg rolls.

scenes.image_prompt: Step-by-step visuals of filling and rolling the egg rolls. Start with the filling placed on the wrapper, then show folding techniques, and finally sealing the egg roll with egg wash.
scenes.voice_over: Lay out an egg roll wrapper with one corner pointing towards you. Place 1-2 tablespoons of the beef and vegetable mixture in the center. Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Tightly roll away from you, sealing the top corner with the egg wash.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls frying in hot oil, bubbling around them. Focus on the golden color they develop as they fry.
scenes.voice_over: Heat canola oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C). Carefully place 2-3 egg rolls into the hot oil and fry for 3-5 minutes, until golden brown and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of golden-brown, crispy egg rolls being removed from the fryer with a slotted spoon and placed on a wire rack.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the egg rolls with a slotted spoon and place them on a wire rack to drain excess oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Final plated dish of crispy egg rolls with a small bowl of Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard for dipping. Garnish with chopped green onions for a pop of color. Some egg rolls can be cut in half to show the filling.
scenes.voice_over: Serve hot with Grey Poupon Dijon Mustard for dipping. These egg rolls are crispy, flavorful, and totally irresistible. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, double fry them. Fry once as directed, then let them cool slightly before frying again for a shorter time until extra crispy.
You can substitute ground turkey or chicken for the ground beef.
If you don't have a deep fryer, you can shallow fry the egg rolls in a large skillet with about 1 inch of oil.
Freeze leftover filling or uncooked egg rolls for a quick meal later.

recipes.name: Crispy Chinese Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1/2-1 pound ground pork (or chicken, or beef)
1 (16 ounce) bag shredded cabbage and carrot coleslaw mix (use most of the bag)
1 large egg, beaten with 1 teaspoon water
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet or wok, brown the ground pork over medium-high heat. Add the chopped ginger and minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together the salt, sugar, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
Step 3: Pour the soy sauce mixture over the cooked pork and stir to combine.
Step 4: In a large bowl, combine the coleslaw mix and sliced green onions. Add the hot pork mixture to the vegetables and stir well.
Step 5: Let the mixture cool slightly before assembling the egg rolls.
Step 6: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface so that it looks like a diamond. Place about 3 tablespoons of the pork filling in the center of the wrapper.
Step 7: Fold the bottom point of the wrapper up over the filling and roll once. Fold in the right and left points.
Step 8: Brush the top point of the wrapper with the beaten egg mixture.
Step 9: Finish rolling the egg roll tightly. Set aside and repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers.
Step 10: Heat 2-3 inches of oil in a large skillet or wok to 350°F (175°C).
Step 11: Fry the egg rolls in batches, 2-3 at a time, for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Do not overcrowd the pan.

Step 12: Remove the cooked egg rolls from the oil and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauces, such as sweet and sour sauce, plum sauce, hoisin sauce, or jalapeño pepper jelly.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy golden-brown Chinese egg rolls, freshly fried, on a dark slate surface.  Focus sharply on the foreground egg roll, revealing its flaky texture and savory filling, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background egg rolls and dipping sauce.  Use soft, directional lighting to highlight the golden hues and glistening surface. Garnish with chopped green onions and a small bowl of sweet and sour sauce. Compose the shot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the egg rolls' cylindrical shape and inviting appeal in a rustic, yet elegant setting.  Evoke a warm and appetizing mood.

video_script.title: Crispy Chinese Egg Rolls
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy and delicious Chinese egg rolls at home with this easy-to-follow recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of golden-brown, crispy egg rolls, some cut open to reveal the savory filling. Focus on the crispy texture and steam rising.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making crispy, flavorful Chinese egg rolls. These are perfect as a snack, appetizer, or even a main course.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: Ground pork, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and sugar.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Ground pork, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and sugar for the filling.

scenes.image_prompt: Coleslaw mix, green onions, egg roll wrappers, and a bowl with a beaten egg are displayed.
scenes.voice_over: You'll also need coleslaw mix, green onions, egg roll wrappers, and an egg for sealing.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground pork browning in a wok or skillet. Ginger and garlic are added.
scenes.voice_over: Brown your ground pork over medium-high heat. Add ginger and garlic, cooking for about a minute until fragrant.

scenes.image_prompt: The soy sauce mixture being poured over the pork and mixed in.
scenes.voice_over: Mix salt, sugar, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. Then, pour it over the pork, stirring to combine.

scenes.image_prompt: Demonstration of filling and rolling an egg roll, step-by-step. Focus on folding techniques.
scenes.voice_over: Lay a wrapper like a diamond. Add 3 tablespoons of filling, fold the bottom corner over, roll once, fold the sides in, brush with egg wash, and roll tightly.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls frying in hot oil, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat 2-3 inches of oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry in batches for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden and crispy. Avoid overcrowding the pan.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished egg rolls, golden brown and crispy, on a plate with dipping sauces.
scenes.voice_over: Drain on paper towels. Serve your egg rolls hot with sweet and sour sauce, plum sauce, or your favorite dipping sauce!

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of plated egg rolls, some whole, some halved to show the filling, garnished with green onions and served with dipping sauces.
scenes.voice_over: Enjoy your crispy Chinese egg rolls!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, double fry them. Fry once as directed, then let them cool slightly. Increase the oil temperature to 375°F (190°C) and fry again for 1-2 minutes per side, until extra crispy.
You can also bake the egg rolls in a preheated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy. This is a healthier alternative to frying.

recipes.name: Crispy Shrimp Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1 large egg, beaten (or water, for sealing)
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the shrimp, cabbage, carrots, water chestnuts, and celery and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Step 3: Add the bean sprouts, scallions, salt, soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), rice wine, and sugar (if using). Stir well to combine.
Step 4: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you (like a diamond).
Step 5: Place 3-4 tablespoons of the shrimp mixture in a line horizontally across the center of the wrapper, leaving about 2 inches of space from the bottom corner.
Step 6: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling. Fold in the left and right corners to the center.
Step 7: Roll the wrapper tightly from the bottom corner up, creating a compact cylinder.
Step 8: Brush the top corner of the wrapper with beaten egg or water to seal the egg roll. Repeat steps 4-8 for remaining egg rolls.
Step 9: Cover the rolled egg rolls with a damp cloth to prevent them from drying out.
Step 10: Heat about 1 inch of oil in a large, deep pan or wok to 375°F (190°C).
Step 11: Fry the egg rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy, turning as needed to ensure even cooking.
Step 12: Remove the egg rolls from the oil and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 13: Serve the egg rolls immediately with your favorite dipping sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy shrimp egg rolls, golden brown and glistening, on a dark slate surface.  Arrange three egg rolls diagonally, one slightly forward for focus.  Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs and a small bowl of sweet chili sauce. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the nearest egg roll's flaky texture. Backlighting should highlight the steam rising from the freshly fried rolls, creating a warm, inviting mood.  Incorporate a textured linen napkin casually draped in the background for added depth.

video_script.title: Crispy Shrimp Egg Rolls
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and crispy shrimp egg rolls with this easy-to-follow recipe!

scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making crispy, flavorful shrimp egg rolls. These are perfect as a snack, appetizer, or even a light meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Shrimp, cabbage, carrots, water chestnuts, and celery being stir-fried in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Add the shrimp, cabbage, carrots, water chestnuts, and celery. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding bean sprouts, scallions, and sauces to the wok, stirring to combine everything.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the bean sprouts, scallions, salt, soy sauce, oyster sauce if using, rice wine, and sugar, if using. Stir well to combine.

scenes.image_prompt: An egg roll wrapper laid out like a diamond with a portion of the shrimp filling placed horizontally across the center.
scenes.voice_over: Place an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you.  Add 3-4 tablespoons of the filling horizontally across the center.

scenes.image_prompt: Show hands folding the bottom corner, then side corners, and tightly rolling the egg roll. Brush the top corner with egg wash.
scenes.voice_over: Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then the side corners to the center. Roll tightly upwards from the bottom to create a cylinder. Seal with beaten egg.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls frying in hot oil in a deep pan. Show them turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat about an inch of oil in a pan to 375°F (190°C). Fry the egg rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy, turning as needed. This will take about 2-3 minutes per batch.

scenes.voice_over: Remove the egg rolls and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of finished egg rolls on a serving platter, garnished with scallions and served with a variety of dipping sauces, like sweet chili sauce, duck sauce, and soy sauce.
scenes.voice_over: These crispy shrimp egg rolls are a guaranteed crowd-pleaser. Give this recipe a try and let me know what you think in the comments below!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, double fry them. Fry once as directed, then remove and let cool slightly. Fry a second time for a few minutes until extra crispy.
You can substitute ground pork or chicken for the shrimp.
Add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the filling for a spicy kick.

recipes.name: Versatile Egg Rolls (Vegetarian or Meat)
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) package firm tofu, or 1 pound lean ground beef, or 1 pound ground pork, or 1 pound ground chicken, or 1 pound shrimp
2 cups finely chopped cabbage (or 1 bag coleslaw mix)
1/2 cup shredded carrots (omit if using coleslaw mix)
1 (16 ounce) package large square egg roll wrappers
Sweet and sour sauce, for dipping
directions: Step 1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tofu (or chosen meat) and ginger. Stir-fry until browned, about 2-3 minutes for meat or 5-7 minutes for tofu.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of three golden-brown, crispy egg rolls, one cut open to reveal the savory filling. Use a dark, textured backdrop and soft, diffused lighting to highlight the textures and colors. Garnish with fresh cilantro and a small dish of dipping sauce. Shallow depth of field with focus on the cut egg roll.  Convey a warm, inviting mood. Props should include chopsticks and a linen napkin. Compose with negative space for potential text overlay.

video_script.title: Versatile Egg Rolls: Vegetarian or Meat
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and crispy egg rolls with your choice of filling: tofu, ground meat, or shrimp!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a golden brown, crispy egg roll cut in half, with steam coming out.  Show dipping sauces in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Craving crispy, flavorful egg rolls? Learn how to make them at home with this versatile recipe. Choose your protein – tofu, ground meat, or shrimp – and customize it to your liking!

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients neatly arranged on a table: protein choices (tofu, ground beef, pork, chicken, or shrimp platter), ginger, cabbage, bean sprouts, shredded carrots, oyster sauce, green onions, egg roll wrappers, and egg whites in separate bowls.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: your choice of protein, ginger, cabbage, bean sprouts, carrots, oyster sauce, green onions, egg roll wrappers, and egg whites. For dipping, we'll have sweet and sour sauce, soy sauce, mustard, and ketchup.

scenes.image_prompt: A large skillet over medium-high heat. Hand adding tofu/meat and minced ginger into the hot skillet.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Add your protein of choice and minced ginger. Stir-fry until browned, about 2-3 minutes for meat or 5-7 minutes for tofu.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands adding chopped cabbage, bean sprouts, and shredded carrots (if using) to the skillet with the browned tofu/meat.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cabbage, bean sprouts, and shredded carrots. If you are using coleslaw mix, it already has carrots so you can skip adding them separately.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hand adding oyster sauce to the stir-fry mix, and chopped green onions being sprinkled on top.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the oyster sauce and green onions. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened but still crisp.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the steps of filling and rolling an egg roll: placing a wrapper on a flat surface, adding the filling, folding in the sides, and rolling it tightly.
scenes.voice_over: Lay out an egg roll wrapper. Add a spoonful of the filling in the center. Fold the sides inwards and then roll from the bottom up, tightly securing it with a little egg white to seal the edge.

scenes.image_prompt: Egg rolls arranged in an air fryer basket, lightly coated with cooking spray.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your air fryer to 400°F (200°C). Arrange the egg rolls in the basket, lightly coated with nonstick cooking spray. Air fry for 10-12 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of finished, golden brown egg rolls on a serving plate, with small bowls of sweet and sour sauce, soy sauce, mustard, and ketchup.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious egg rolls hot with your choice of dipping sauces – sweet and sour, soy sauce, mustard, and ketchup. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: A hand picking up a crispy egg roll and dipping it into sweet and sour sauce.
scenes.voice_over: These versatile egg rolls are perfect as a snack, appetizer, or even a light meal.  Try them with different fillings and sauces to find your favorite combination!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, lightly brush the outsides with oil before pan-frying.
If using tofu, press it beforehand to remove excess water. This will help it brown better.
Don't overfill the egg rolls, or they may burst open during cooking.
Serve with a variety of dipping sauces for added flavor.

recipes.name: Egg and Nori Rolls with Wasabi Dipping Sauce
ingredients: 1 medium carrot, peeled and cut into thick matchsticks
2 celery stalks, trimmed and cut into thick matchsticks
40 g snow pea sprouts, stems trimmed
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, wasabi paste, and 60 ml of water until well combined. Cover and set aside.
Step 2: Crack the eggs into a large jug and add the remaining 65 ml of water and salt. Whisk until well combined.
Step 3: Heat 1 teaspoon of butter in a 20-cm non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat until foaming.
Step 4: Pour a quarter of the egg mixture into the pan and tilt to cover the base evenly.
Step 5: As the omelette begins to set, lift the edges to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Step 6: Cook, uncovered, for 2 minutes, or until set.
Step 7: Slide the omelette onto a large plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining butter and egg mixture in 3 more batches.
Step 8: Lay the omelettes flat on a clean surface. Top each with a sheet of nori.
Step 9: Divide the carrot, celery, and snow pea sprouts among the nori sheets, placing them down the center of each.
Step 10: Tightly roll up each omelette and trim the edges.
Step 11: Cut the rolls in half and arrange them on a serving plate. Serve with the reserved wasabi dipping sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture vibrant Egg and Nori Rolls, sliced to reveal the colorful carrot, celery, and snow pea sprout filling, against a dark, textured backdrop. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the foreground roll's filling. Soft, directional light should highlight the egg's delicate texture and the nori's sheen. Incorporate minimalist props like a small, dark ceramic dish with the wasabi dipping sauce and a few scattered sesame seeds. Aim for a sophisticated and inviting mood with a slightly low angle shot.

video_script.title: Egg & Nori Rolls with Wasabi Dipping Sauce
video_script.description: Learn to make these fresh and flavorful Egg and Nori Rolls with a zesty Wasabi Dipping Sauce. Perfect for a light lunch, snack, or appetizer!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished egg and nori rolls, sliced in half, arranged on a serving plate with a small bowl of wasabi dipping sauce. Focus on the vibrant colors and textures of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making fresh and flavorful Egg and Nori Rolls with a zesty Wasabi Dipping Sauce. These are perfect for a light lunch, snack, or appetizer!

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients for the wasabi dipping sauce and egg mixture arranged neatly: soy sauce, wasabi paste, water, eggs, and salt.
scenes.voice_over: For the sauce, we'll need soy sauce, wasabi paste, and water. For the egg rolls, gather your eggs, a pinch of salt, and some extra water for a light and fluffy texture.

scenes.image_prompt: Show butter in a pan, starting to melt. Display prepped carrots, celery, and snow pea sprouts on a separate plate.
scenes.voice_over: Melt butter in a pan over medium-high heat. While the butter melts, let's prep our filling: carrot, celery, and snow pea sprouts, all cut into thick matchsticks.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisk eggs with water and salt in a jug. Then, pour a quarter of the egg mixture into the hot, buttered pan.
scenes.voice_over: Whisk the eggs, water, and salt until light and airy. Now, pour a quarter of the egg mixture into the hot pan, making sure it spreads evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up view of lifting edges of the almost-set omelet to let uncooked egg run underneath.
scenes.voice_over: As the omelette sets, gently lift the edges to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath. Cook for about 2 minutes until set. Repeat this process for the remaining egg mixture to make four omelettes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a finished omelette being laid flat and topped with a sheet of nori.  Beside it, display the prepped vegetable filling.

scenes.voice_over: Tightly roll up the omelette and nori, tucking in the filling as you go. Trim the edges for a clean, professional look.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished egg rolls arranged on a serving platter, sliced in half, garnished with a few snow pea sprouts, and presented alongside the small bowl of wasabi dipping sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Slice the rolls in half and arrange them on a serving plate with the wasabi dipping sauce.  These delicious Egg & Nori Rolls are ready to be enjoyed!  Per serving, this recipe packs around 200 calories with 12 grams of protein, 15 grams of carbs, and 10 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For easier rolling, use a sushi rolling mat.
If you don't have snow pea sprouts, you can substitute with bean sprouts or spinach.
Adjust the amount of wasabi paste to your preferred level of spiciness.

recipes.name: Cherry Cream Cheese Egg Rolls
ingredients: 1/4 cup dried tart red cherries, chopped
directions: Step 1: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together the softened cream cheese and cherry jam until smooth. Stir in the chopped dried cherries.
Step 3: Place a wonton wrapper on a clean work surface with one corner pointing towards you. Lightly moisten the edges of the wrapper with water.
Step 4: Spoon a rounded teaspoon of the cherry cream cheese mixture onto the center of the wonton wrapper.
Step 5: Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, tucking it under the filling on the opposite side.
Step 6: Fold the side corners over the filling, then tightly roll the egg roll away from you towards the remaining corner.
Step 7: Repeat steps 3-6 with the remaining wonton wrappers and filling.
Step 8: Lightly coat both sides of the assembled egg rolls with nonstick cooking spray.
Step 9: Arrange the egg rolls in a single layer in the air fryer basket.  Cook in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding.
Step 10: Cook in the preheated air fryer for 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 11: While the egg rolls are cooking, whisk together the sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl.
Step 12: Remove the cooked egg rolls from the air fryer and immediately roll them in the cinnamon sugar mixture, using two forks to ensure even coating.
Step 13: Place the coated egg rolls on a wire rack to cool slightly for 5-10 minutes before serving warm.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three golden-brown, crispy Cherry Cream Cheese Egg Rolls on a rustic wooden board, dusted with powdered sugar. A small dish of cherry jam sits beside them.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the front egg roll's flaky layers and the oozing cherry filling where one has been bitten into. Soft, diffused natural light from the side highlights the textures.  A dark, moody background with a hint of blurred greenery adds depth and richness. Garnish with a few scattered dried cherries and a dusting of cinnamon around the board.  Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the stack and filling.

video_script.title: Cherry Cream Cheese Egg Rolls

recipes.name: Antipasto Egg Rolls
directions: Step 1: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface in a diamond shape. Place a slice of provolone cheese in the center. Top with one slice of ham, 3 slices of pepperoni, and a large pinch each of shredded mozzarella cheese and sliced pepperoncini.
Step 2: Fold the bottom half of the wrapper up over the filling, then tightly fold in the sides. Gently roll up the egg roll and seal the edge with a couple of drops of water.

Step 3: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. The oil should reach a depth of about 1 inch. Test the oil by adding a drop of water; it should pop and bubble when the oil is hot enough.
Step 4: Carefully place the egg rolls in the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 1 minute per side.
Step 5: Transfer the cooked egg rolls to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Step 6: Garnish with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and fresh parsley. Serve immediately with Italian dressing on the side for dipping.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of three crispy golden-brown antipasto egg rolls, one cut open to reveal the melted cheese and savory filling.  Use a dark, rustic wooden surface and a linen napkin as backdrop. Shallow depth of field, focusing on the cut egg roll's gooey cheese. Garnish with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan. Soft, natural lighting should highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood. Pepperoncini and Italian dressing in small dipping bowls in the background, slightly blurred.

video_script.title: Antipasto Egg Rolls: The Perfect Party Snack
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy, cheesy, and flavorful Antipasto Egg Rolls with this easy-to-follow recipe!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of golden-brown, crispy antipasto egg rolls stacked on a plate, garnished with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese. A small bowl of Italian dressing is placed next to the egg rolls.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a delicious and easy appetizer? Look no further! These Antipasto Egg Rolls are the perfect party snack, combining the classic flavors of an Italian antipasto platter in a crispy, golden shell.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board. Group similar items together, such as cheeses, meats, and produce.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: egg roll wrappers, provolone cheese slices, deli ham, pepperoni slices, shredded mozzarella, sliced pepperoncini, vegetable oil for frying, Parmesan cheese, fresh parsley, and Italian dressing.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands laying an egg roll wrapper in a diamond shape and filling it with provolone, ham, pepperoni, mozzarella, and pepperoncini.
scenes.voice_over: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface like a diamond. Place a slice of provolone in the center, top with ham, three slices of pepperoni, and a pinch each of mozzarella and pepperoncini.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands folding and rolling the egg roll, sealing the edge with water.
scenes.voice_over: Fold the bottom half of the wrapper up, then fold in the sides tightly. Roll it up gently and seal the edge with a drop of water.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of vegetable oil heating in a skillet. Show a drop of water being added to the oil and popping to demonstrate it's ready.
scenes.voice_over: Heat about an inch of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Test the oil by adding a drop of water - it should sizzle when ready.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of egg rolls frying in the hot oil, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully place the egg rolls in the hot oil. Fry for about a minute per side until golden and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the fried egg rolls being transferred to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the egg rolls and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished egg rolls garnished with Parmesan and parsley, served with Italian dressing.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and parsley. Serve immediately with Italian dressing for dipping. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand picking up a finished egg roll and dipping it in a bowl of italian dressing. In the background, the rest of the eggrolls are visible along with the used frying pan.
scenes.voice_over: These Antipasto Egg Rolls are perfect as a game-day snack, party appetizer, or even a fun weeknight dinner.  Each serving has approximately 250 calories, 15g of protein, 12g of carbs, and 18g of fat. Give them a try and let me know what you think!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, you can double fry them. Fry once as directed, then remove from the oil and let cool slightly. Fry a second time until extra crispy.
If you don't have fresh parsley, you can use dried parsley flakes for garnish.
You can adjust the amount of pepperoncini to your liking. For a spicier egg roll, add more pepperoncini.
